abstract.text: A type used to format lists of items with a separator and conjunction appropriate for a given locale.
The size of the list.
The type of the list.
The locale to use when formatting items in the list.
A type used to format lists of items with a separator and conjunction appropriate for a given locale.
Creates an instance using the provided format style.
The type representing the width of a list.
A type that describes whether the returned list contains cumulative or alternative elements.
Modifies the list format style to use the specified locale.
Creates a list format style using the provided format style and list style.
Creates a list format style using the provided type and width.
Creates a locale-aware string representation of the value.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.
Encodes this value into the given encoder.
The type of data to format.
The type of the formatted data.
The hash value of the style format.
Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two values are equal.
The capitalization formatting context used when formatting dates and times.
Collections of behaviors for traits like numeric precision, rounding, and scale, used for formatting and parsing numeric values.
